text: Hey :wave: I'm new to HubSpot CMS as well as this Slack so lmk if there's a better place to post this question. Basically, in the drag n' drop template builder, I'm trying to augment two module groups that are positioned side by side (or flexible columns for that matter) with flexbox properties. For example, I'd like to align-items-center between some text content in one module group and an image in another module group. The problem I'm currently running into is that HubSpot automatically wraps the content with additional, nested DOM elements that I don't have control over in the editor, so the flexbox classes don't apply correctly to the nested components I'm trying to target. Is there a way to do this without creating a custom module in HubL?
my template consists of one flexible column and everything that goes into that column are custom modules that i build and control
For example, I'm using some flexbox utility classes on the module group here that are incorrectly applied since the nested components are wrapped in further elements
I see, so you're falling back to the custom module route.
The issue with the drag n drop is a case of divitus
so you have to target the div inside of your class that is most of the time two levels deep
got it, that makes using atomic style libraries like tailwind a bit more difficult. perhaps then it's better to create custom modules in those situations
most of the seasoned HS dev do that exactly
Sorry.  I ran away, but Chad is better than me anyway
